title: rev-save -r doesn't save full dataset hierarchy

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: Issue is unlikely to be addressed

body:
I'm working on switching `run` over to using `rev_save` and bringing in -revolution's run tests.  In the process, I was replacing a `.add(".", recursive=True)` call in `test_run_inputs_outputs` with `.rev_save(recursive=True)` and couldn't get `rev_save` to save the entire dataset hierarchy.

I've isolated the setup from that test to the script at the bottom of this post.  Here's an overview of the differences:

```
% datalad status -d saved-with-add -r
% datalad status -d saved-with-rev_save -r
 modified: s0 (dataset)
untracked: s0/s1_0 (directory)
untracked: s0/s1_1 (directory)
untracked: s0/ss (directory)

% datalad subdatasets -d saved-with-add -r
subdataset(ok): s0 (dataset)
subdataset(ok): s0/s1_0 (dataset)
subdataset(ok): s0/s1_0/s2 (dataset)
subdataset(ok): s0/s1_1 (dataset)
subdataset(ok): s0/s1_1/s2 (dataset)
subdataset(ok): s0/ss (dataset)
action summary:
  subdataset (ok: 6)
% datalad subdatasets -d saved-with-rev_save -r
subdataset(ok): s0 (dataset)
```

So, `rev-save` adds s0 to the root dataset (save-with-rev_save) but doesn't seem to register the subdatasets further down the tree.

<details>
<summary>script</summary>

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python3

import os.path as op
import tempfile

from datalad.api import Dataset
from datalad.tests.utils import create_tree

tempdir = tempfile.mkdtemp()


def add(ds):
    ds.add(".", recursive=True)


def rev_save(ds):
    ds.rev_save(recursive=True)


for savefn in [add, rev_save]:
    root = op.join(tempdir, "saved-with-" + savefn.__name__)
    create_tree(root,
                {"s0": {"s1_0": {"s2": {"a.dat": "a",
                                        "b.txt": "b"}},
                        "s1_1": {"s2": {"c.dat": "c",
                                        "d.txt": "d"}},
                        "ss": {"e.dat": "e"}}})

    for subds in [("s0", "s1_0", "s2"),
                  ("s0", "s1_1", "s2"),
                  ("s0", "s1_0"),
                  ("s0", "s1_1"),
                  ("s0", "ss"),
                  ("s0",)]:
        Dataset(op.join(*((root,) + subds))).rev_create(force=True)
    ds = Dataset(root).rev_create(force=True)
    savefn(ds)

print(tempdir)
```

</details>
